p: Cancer with bone metastases compared to other metastatic sites is considered as associated with a better prognosis, particularly for breast and prostate cancer despite a significant impact on the patient's quality of life and autonomy. Many randomized controlled trials have demonstrated the efficacy of first-line palliative conventional radiotherapy for painful bone metastases [ 1â€“ 4]. The advent of novel imaging techniques allows an increasing an early detection and diagnosis of oligometastatic disease. In clinical practice the possibility to identify a few number of lesions, better defined recently by ASTRO, EORTC and ESTRO, it is considered an intermediate phase of tumor spread with limited metastatic capacity [ 5, 6].
